citation.article-title: Legionella moravica sp. nov. and Legionella brunensis sp. nov. isolated from cooling-tower water.

p.s: Description of Legionella moravica sp. nov.
Legionella moravica (more.a'vi.ca, L. gen. n. moravica coming from Moravia, Czechoslovakia)
Legionella moravica is a Gram-negative, catalase-positive rod which produces beta-lactamase and does not hydrolyse hippurate.
Its biochemical reaction are typical of the genus Legionella as described above.
Its cellular fatty acids are predominately branch-chained.
It is serologically different from other described Legionella species.
The type strain of L. moravica is 316-36 (ATCC 43877, CDC 1634-CZK-E), which has a G+C content of 41.5 mol%.
It was isolated from cooling-tower water.
